name: 王清祿
objective:
本課程設計重點有三：(1)藉由精選的中級程度教材加強學生必備的基礎文法觀念和句型結構；(2)使學生確切把握閱讀要領以及充分瞭解寫作的各種技巧，重心在生字、片語、句法的解釋和基本寫作技巧的分析；(3)透過練習加強聽、說、讀、寫的知能及表達。
★ 教學目標與內容
定位：中級或以上的英文閱讀。由於每週僅有兩小時，非常珍貴，所以與其他課程區隔，如會話、聽力。上課採中英混合。
務實面：
一、閱讀為主：（1）大量閱讀。（2）深度與批判閱讀。透過閱讀訓練與課堂英文口語表達學習語法、句子結構與作文技巧。
二、周邊學習：（一）必要時加發講義，內容側重語言學習類、科技類、人文類、學習方法類。（二）培養口語表達能力，如《辦公室情境英語會話比賽》。（三）鼓勵同學利用本校提供的周邊學習管道《英語角落》等。
三、寒假作業測驗：（一）為保持英語語感，指定寒假作業，於下學期第二週測驗。（二）從《獎勵大學教學卓越計畫職場英文精進系列：辦公室情境英語會話》中挑選一個單元，全班分組，預定第五～第七周進行班內比賽。
理想面：透過教學材料的啟發性、創意、知識性、實用性、以及娛樂性，（1）提升英語文能力。（2）誘發英語學習興趣。（3）培養健康的英文學習觀念與方法。（4）進而提升人文與科技素養。
＊ ＊ ＊ ＊ ＊ ＊ ＊
★ Teaching Goals and Content
Realistically, this course aims to equip students with intermediate or higher reading skills in focus on:  (1) extensive reading at large volume and (2) intensive reading in in-depth and critical ways.  Other skill areas such as grammar, sentence structures, vocabulary building, and writing are also reinforced through reading. Class will be conducted in part English, part Chinese.  If needed, handouts will be given as supporting.
Another goal of this course is to engage students in a variety of extended and outside English-learning programs made available by the English Department.  Among them is English Conversation Competition, as with the title Everyday Office Talks (辦公室情境英語會話比賽), a cross-semester project organized and overseen by the Dept. that started last semester.  Others are English Corner, Learning English through Newspaper, to name but a few.
Still, to be regularly exposed to English, students have to do home assignments during their winter break, including: (1) readings from the textbook, and (2) oral assignments from Everyday Office Talks.  Students will take a reading test on the second week of this semester and an oral test/competition in small groups of 4-6 persons.
Finally, and ideally, this course is designed for the majority of NTUT science- and technology-based majors in ways that help them (1) enhance language acquisition, (2) form good reading and English-learning habits, (3) develop students' interest in English, and (4) promote humanity and technology literacy.       ■
